default.$description: Used for informative icons and should be paired with text that conveys the same meaning.
Used to convey informative messages, link, etc.

low.$description: Secondary background color is used when there is a need to emphasize specific semantics.

high.$description: Brand color is exclusively reserved for Buttons and should be used sparingly for the most prominent object in the UI.

medium.$description: Tertiary background color is used for prominent semantics, generally for selection, info, etc.

default.$description: Primary background color for informative component.
Used for critical icons and should be paired with text that conveys the same meaning.
Used to indicate critical or potentially harmful situations.

low.$description: Secondary background color for critical component.

high.$description: Brand accent colors are frequently used on supporting main components, such as tags.

medium.$description: Tertiary background color is used for prominent semantics, generally for negative/critical meanings, etc.Tertiary background color is used for prominent semantics, generally for negative/critical meanings, etc.

default.$description: Primary background color for critical component.

low.$description: Used for trivial information and should be used sparingly.

high.$description: Used for high-importance text, such as heading and titles.

medium.$description: Commonly used for body text or any other content.

inverse.$description: Used for typography on dark or colored backgrounds.

disabled.$description: Used for inactive or disabled text.

inverse-disabled.$description: Used for disabled text on dark or colored backgrounds.

low.$description: Secondary background color for components that require a lower visual weight.

high.$description: High contrast and used for the prominent background color.

medium.$description: Tertiary background color, generally used for clickable objects on a white background, such as text fields, etc.

default.$description: Primary background color for most components and sections of the interface.

disabled.$description: Inactive or unavailable component background color.

default.$description: Used for success icons and should be paired with text that conveys the same meaning.
Used to indicate successful or positive outcomes.

low.$description: Secondary background color for positive outcomes.

high.$description: Brand accent colors are frequently used on supporting main components, such as tags.

medium.$description: Tertiary background color is used for prominent semantics, such as success or positive meanings.

default.$description: Primary background color for positive outcomes.
Used for alert icons and should be paired with text that conveys the same meaning.
Used to indicate that the user needs to pay attention.

low.$description: Secondary background color for alert component.

high.$description: Brand accent colors are frequently used on supporting main components, such as tags.

medium.$description: Tertiary background color is used for prominent semantics, generally for alert/warning.

default.$description: Primary background color for alert component.
